What is Project Breakpoint?

Project Breakpoint is a brand I created a long time ago. It is not a business, I do not try to make money off of it. It's a name for me to slap on my web content and call it mine.

A Little About Me

My name is Jonathan Kuhl and I am a web developer. I started learning web development back in the days of HTML4 when I was in high school. I also learned some game programming with 3d GameStudio and their C-Script language. I didn't stay with it and that is something I'll regret the rest of my life, because there is a gap in my experience between HTML4, and when I picked up HTML5 again in 2017.

I went to college first for Aviation Flight Operations and then for Air Traffic Control. This plan didn't pan out so I switched gears in 2017 towards web and software development. Most of the things on this site are resources that I've used to advance my knowledge.

I have put my focus in JavaScript and web development as well as React, Angular and Vue. I'm focusing on Front End, though I have interest in Node.js, Express, and Mongo. I also know some SQL. Beyond web development, I know Python and Swift.

Outside of programming, I like to write. I have a few unpublished novels that are half-developed, that I work on now and then. I usually participate in NaNoWriMo, if you're a writer, check it out. I like to write sci-fi and fantasy.

Professionally, I'm an NCO in the United States Air Force Reserves at Westover ARB. I've also held several jobs in the civilian sector. I was a lift operator for Sunday River, Maine, a ramp agent for JetBlue and United at Portland International, in Maine, and most recently, a relationship manager for Barclays.
